issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

fields.summary: Volumes get into state where vg is assigned to /dev/null/..., are stuck in "deleting" state indefinitely

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

I'm not sure how to reproduce, but I suspect these volumes were unattached after restarting the cloud controller / storage controller (same host)

It looks like we may be missing initialization of the volume group in DASManager#unexportVolumeFromAll or should instead be using the volume group name from the volume metadata.

comments.body: [~sgraham], could you have a look into this issue?

[~alice] also observed this issue in QA recently. As [~sjones] has pointed out, unexport logic has the incorrect volume group - /dev/null which is why all attempts to unexport the volume fail. Deletion also fails subsequently as the volume is exported. This could be an initialization issue after cloud restart (volume group variable is used before its initialized). In [~alice]'s case there was no restart that I could trace in the logs. Either way, the volume group is stored in the database as metadata and would make for a more accurate source of information. 

EDIT Try replacing {{volumeGroup}} with {{foundLVMVolumeInfo.getVgName()}} on [Line 1187|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/425f29a550ce0f26a77435932a350ed93d97228f/clc/modules/block-storage/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/blockstorage/DASManager.java#L1187]

Thanks [~sgraham], yes, that looks like it would fix the bug.

However, there may be another reason for the bug: In all other methods that need the volume group, they call {{updateVolumeGroup()}} at the start of the method, which assigns the static string {{volumeGroup}} if it's null. This {{unexportVolumeFromAll()}} method does not call it, yet it references {{volumeGroup}} (before your fix).

Would a better fix be to add the {{updateVolumeGroup();}} call to the start of the {{unexportVolumeFromAll()}} method?

Hi [~lincoln.thomas],

I believe for {{unexportVolumeFromAll()}} that {{foundLVMVolumeInfo.getAbsoluteLVPath()}} is correct. The 'found' volume is loaded from the database and the authoritative volumeGroup is already present in the column. Fetching from the DB and then stitching in parsed {{LVMWrapper}} output seems to be a waste of time.

In other cases we *do* need to fetch the volumeGroup information via {{updateVolumeGroup()}} since we are in the act of physically creating the volume.
I don't see mentioned error in the logs.
